articleController.py module

articleController.all_searched_words_exist(searched_words, strings_retrieved)[source]

all searched words exist

this method returns wether or not a word from the list of words exists in one of the strings provided

Parameters:

  • searched_words (list) – list of words that we want to check the existence of the strings

  • strings_retrieved (list) – list of strings in which we should check the existence of one of the words

Returns:

boolean saying wether on of the words exists in one of the strings provided

Return type:

bool

articleController.check_all_words_existence(words, text_content)[source]

check all words existence

this method checks wether at least one word “from the word list” exists in the text

Parameters:

  • words (list) – the list of words that we check the existence in the text

  • text_content (string) – the full text in which we search the existence of the words

Returns:

Boolean saying wether one of the words exists in the text or not

Return type:

bool

articleController.delete_article(id)

Delete an article.

This endpoint allows the deletion of an article by specifying its ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the article to be deleted.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

articleController.getArticleByID(article_id)

Get an article by ID

This endpoint allows acessing a specefic article through its ID

Parameters:

article_id (int) – the ID of the article

Returns:

JSON structure containing detailed information about the article, or an error message if something went wrong

Return type:

flask.Response

articleController.is_between_dates(initial_date_str, final_date_str, date_to_check_str)[source]

is between dates

this method makes a given date is in between two specified dates

Parameters:

  • initial_date_str (string) – initial date

  • final_date_str (string) – final date

  • date_to_check_str (string) – the date to check wether it is between the initial and final date

Returns:

Boolean saying wether the provided date is included in the time interval or not

Return type:

bool

articleController.manageArticleSearch()

manage article search

this endpoint allows the server to perform a search operation of articles through elastic search engine, the query is provided in the body of the request

Returns:

a list of article headers “basic information” that are relevant to the query provided in the request body

Return type:

flask.Response

articleController.manageArticles()

manage articles

This endpoint allows to either update an existing article by providing the exact information of the updated article in the request body, or upload a new article “that is converting the uploaded pdf to a json structure that will be indexed by elastic search”, by provding the pdf file name in the request body

Returns:

JSON response indicating success/failure of the upload/update operation

Return type:

flask.Response

articleController.normalize_string(s)[source]

normalise string

This method modifies a string, deletes non-Ascii characters, and makes sure it returns a valid Unicode string

Parameters:

s (string) – the string input “to normalize”

Returns:

a valid Unicode string

Return type:

string

articleController.stringSpliterLower(string)[source]

String splitter lower

This method splites a string “more specefically a sentence” into an array of words, making sure they are in lowercase

Parameters:

string (string) – the sentence we want to split into words

Returns:

a list “an array” of lowercased words

Return type:

list
